titles.title: POW/MIA Accounting and Recovery Support Act of 2013

To require the Secretary of Defense to allow civilian employees of the Department of Defense to delay furloughs until returning from a deployment in support of accounting and recovery efforts by the Joint POW/MIA Accounting Command.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Armed Services.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Readiness.

term.name: Government employee pay, benefits, personnel management

bill.summary: 4/12/2013--Introduced. POW/MIA Accounting and Recovery Support Act of 2013 - Requires the Secretary of Defense (DOD) to allow DOD civilian employees who are required to take a furlough that would otherwise occur during their deployment in support of accounting and recovery efforts by the Joint POW/MIA Accounting Command to take such furlough after returning from the deployment.
